Package gameClient

Class Arena

java.lang.Object
gameClient.Arena
public class Arena
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents the arena of a scenario in the game, using a directed weighted graph, and lists of agents and pokemons. The class can check for each pokemon which edge is the one that the pokemon stands on, update pokemons as targets to the agents and create pokemon and agent lists from JSON files.

    • DisassemblyIntoComponents

      public static void DisassemblyIntoComponents​(int rs, game_service game, directed_weighted_graph graph)
      if the graph is not strongly connected, we need to send agents as much as Connectivity components we can this method makes sure that every component has at least one agent in it
      Parameters:
      rs - int number of agents
      game - game_service scenario of the game
      graph - directed_weighted_graph graph of the game

    • start

      public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> start​(java.util.ArrayList<CL_Pokemon> pokemons, int agentSize)
      this method is a duplicate of the 'init' method in Ex2 class, but its made for testing the initializing - beacuse we don't have access to the levels of the game at the server, so we can't be sure if we're managing the simulation on the right way
      Parameters:
      pokemons - ArrayList
      agentSize - int number of agents
      Returns:
      List keys of nodes to put agents in for start

    • start1

      public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> start1​(java.util.ArrayList<CL_Pokemon> pokemons, int agentSize)
      help method for start method, made for testing as explained at start this method actually place the agents
      Parameters:
      pokemons - ArrayList
      agentSize - int
      Returns:
      LinkedList of keys of nodes which leading to a pokemon (sorted by values of pokemons)

    • DisassemblyIntoComponents

      public static java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> DisassemblyIntoComponents​(int rs, directed_weighted_graph graph)
      same as first disassemblyintocomponents , but for testing
      Parameters:
      rs - number of agents allowed
      graph - directed_weighted_graph graph of the game
      Returns:
      LinkedListkeys of nodes in different connectivity components
